snippet: Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center paid a ransom in bitcoins equivalent to about $17,000 to hackers who infiltrated and disabled its computer network.
abstract: Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center CEO Allen Stefanek says they have paid about $17,000 in ransom to hackers who disabled hospital's network; network is now operating again, and neither law enforcement nor hospital indicate who might be responsible for attack or if there are suspects.
lead_paragraph: Hollywood Presbyterian Medical Center paid a ransom in bitcoins equivalent to about $17,000 to hackers who infiltrated and disabled its computer network.

headline.main: California: Hospital Pays Bitcoin Ransom to Hackers
headline.print_headline: California: Hospital Pays Bitcoin Ransom to Hackers
